Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of accidents narrowly averted at the busy intersection by only showing a portion of the original video where accidents occur.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only provides a brief description of a video without any evidence or data to back up the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video accurately represents real accidents narrowly averted at the intersection, but it is later revealed to be a CGI creation and an "experiment" in visual effects.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the video is a result of special effects and editing work, as explained by the YouTube user who uploaded the original video.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting the initial portion of the video as evidence of narrowly averted accidents, while failing to mention the subsequent major crash that occurs in the full video.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video is not a real depiction of accidents narrowly averted at the intersection, but rather a CGI creation and an experiment in visual effects.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
